TrcCommonLib.trclib

Class TrcTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • TrcCommonLib.trclib.TrcTimer

  • public class TrcTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a timer that will signal an event or make a notification callback when the time has expired. This is useful for doing delays in autonomous.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TrcTimer(java.lang.String instanceName)
      Constructor: Creates an instance of the timer with the given name.

        public TrcTimer(java.lang.String instanceName)
        Constructor: Creates an instance of the timer with the given name.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns the instance name.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        instance name.

      • set

        public void set(double time,
                TrcEvent event,
                TrcNotifier.Receiver receiver)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This methods sets the expire time relative to the current time. When the time expires, it will signal the given event if any and call back the notification receiver if any.
        Parameters:
        time - specifies the expire time in seconds relative to the current time.
        event - specifies the event to signal when time has expired.
        receiver - specifies the notification receiver to call when time has expired.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when set is called more than once without a call to cancel() between them.

      • set

        public void set(double time,
                TrcEvent event)
        This methods sets the expire time relative to the current time. When the time expires, it will signal the given event.
        Parameters:
        time - specifies the expire time in seconds relative to the current time.
        event - specifies the event to signal when time has expired.

      • set

        public void set(double time,
                TrcNotifier.Receiver receiver)
        This methods sets the expire time relative to the current time. When the time expires, it will call back the notification receiver.
        Parameters:
        time - specifies the expire time in seconds relative to the current time.
        receiver - specifies the notification receiver to call when time has expired.

      • getExpiredTimeInMsec

        public long getExpiredTimeInMsec()
        This method returns the expired timestamp in milliseconds. If the timer is not set, it returns 0.
        Returns:
        expired timestamp in msec.

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()
        This method checks if the timer has expired.
        Returns:
        true if the timer has expired, false otherwise.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        This method checks if the timer is active (i.e. running and not expired)
        Returns:
        true if the timer is active, false otherwise.

      • setExpired

        public void setExpired(double securityKey)
        This method is called by TrcTimerMgr when the timer has expired. DO NOT call this if you are not TrcTimerMgr.
        Parameters:
        securityKey - specifies the security key returned to you by TrcTimerMgr when you added your timer. This is a simple authentication measure to make sure the caller is indeed TrcTimeMgr.

      • isCanceled

        public boolean isCanceled()
        This method checks if the timer was canceled.
        Returns:
        true if the timer was canceled, false otherwise.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        This method cancels the timer if it's set but has not expired. If the timer is canceled, the event is signaled.
